verses.text: Then Jonah prayed unto the \sc Lord\sc* his God out of the fishâ€™s belly,
and said, I cried by reason of mine affliction unto the \sc Lord\sc*, and he heard me; Out of the belly of hell cried I, \add and\add* thou heardest my voice.
For thou hadst cast me \add into\add* the deep, in the midst of the seas; And the floods compassed me about: All thy billows and thy waves passed over me.
Then I said, I am cast out of thy sight; Yet I will look again toward thy holy temple.
The waters compassed me about, \add even\add* to the soul: The depth closed me round about, The weeds \add were\add* wrapt about my head.
I went down to the bottoms of the mountains; The earth \add with\add* her bars \add was\add* about me for ever: Yet hast thou brought up my life from corruption, O \sc Lord\sc* my God.
When my soul fainted within me I remembered the \sc Lord\sc*: And my prayer came in unto thee, into thine holy temple.
They that observe lying vanities forsake their own mercy.
But I will sacrifice unto thee with the voice of thanksgiving; I will pay \add that\add* that I have vowed. Salvation \add is\add* of the \sc Lord\sc*.
And the \sc Lord\sc* spake unto the fish, and it vomited out Jonah upon the dry \add land\add*.
